items.title: How investigators pieced together the plot to target Bondi
items.description: Security camera footage captured the Bondi Beach gunmen carrying what appears to be firearms out of a south-west Sydney property on the morning of the terror attack, court documents reveal.

items.title: Live: PM speaking after national security meeting
items.description: Anthony Albanese is holding a press conference in Canberra, after meeting with the National Security Committee this morning. Follow live.

items.title: Fast cars and big debts: The unravelling of Steve Cubis
items.description: Steven Cubis hides behind a charming facade, but his former lover and friends say the career con man ruined them financially and emotionally long before he was caught up in allegations of a multi-million-dollar fraud.

items.title: Plans to burn rare forest abandoned after man camps in tree for six nights
items.description: The WA government abandons plans to burn a parcel of forest that is home to a species of rare tree after a 70-year-old man spent six nights living in the canopy.

items.title: Australia names Boxing Day Ashes replacements for Cummins and Lyon
items.description: West Australian fast bowler Jhye Richardson comes into Australia's squad for the fourth Ashes Test, while Victorian off spinner Todd Murphy has been named, and is a chance to play his eighth match and first on Australian soil.

items.title: 'I feel that I live in a cage': West Bank annexation push ongoing despite Trump's opposition
items.description: Despite US President Donald Trump's objections to the annexation of the West Bank, new settlement projects are still being approved. Some Israelis are excited, while Palestinians are left fearful.

items.title: Trump sparks Denmark's anger by appointing US envoy to Greenland
items.description: US President Donald Trump appoints a special envoy to Greenland, drawing renewed criticism from Denmark and the territory's leader over Washington's interest in the mineral-rich Arctic island.

items.title: It's not just the Epstein files — these other issues are splitting Trump's base
items.description: The release of the Epstein files followed some of Donald Trump's dedicated supporters launching a rare revolt against the US president. Here are six more issues that could also divide Republicans.

items.title: World's largest warship looms near Venezuela as US warns of land attacks
items.description: The Pentagon moved the USS Gerald R Ford, the world's largest aircraft carrier, to the Caribbean last month. Now, President Donald Trump is repeating threats of imminent strikes against Venezuelan territory.

items.title: Call of Duty co-founder Vince Zampella reportedly killed in Ferrari crash
items.description: Vince Zampella has died after a crash on a scenic road north of Los Angeles, according to local broadcaster NBC4.

items.title: Scientists warn deadly bird flu outbreak about to become reality for Australia
items.description: The Isle of May is the epicentre of a deadly outbreak of the H5N1 bird flu strain which has spread throughout the globe. Scientists are warning Australia could be next.

items.title: Live: Gold jumps to fresh record as Santa rally continues on share market
items.description: The Australian share market opens up while the price of gold jumps to a fresh record. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: British singer-songwriter Chris Rea dies aged 74
items.description: The man best known for his festive hit Driving Home for Christmas died surrounded by his family.

items.title: Unattended caravans 'ghost camping' at free sites spark debate over fair access
items.description: Unattended caravans line a popular Murray River campsite, triggering debate over whether public camping spots are being quietly claimed ahead of the busy holiday season.

items.title: Man who hired crane to attack another man's home gets home detention
items.description: A Mount Gambier man is sentenced after hiring a crane and partially destroying another man's home.

items.title: Festive season to bring Perth heatwave, Indian Ocean cyclone
items.description: Perth is expected to hit a high of 41 degrees on Christmas Day with the Cocos (Keeling) Islands bracing for a tropical cyclone that could intensify to a category two system.

items.title: Landmark Italian league game in Perth cancelled over 'unacceptable demands'
items.description: A historic Serie A soccer clash between AC Milan and Como at Perth Stadium in February is called off, with sanctions imposed by the Asian Football Confederation blamed for making it "impossible".

items.title: Quiz: Can you pick the real Christmas movies from these unhinged plots?
items.description: Once December rolls around, there's nothing the minor movie studios love more than getting their most unhinged Christmas tropes out of cold storage.

items.title: Car bomb kills Russian army general in Moscow, officials say
items.description: The Kremlin is probing who is behind the killing, which has similarities to previous attacks by Ukrainian special services.

items.title: 'Extremely cunning': Taipei metro attacker planned assault for over a year
items.description: Police in Taiwan say Chang Wen purchased grenades, gas canisters and respirators in the year leading up to Friday's attack.

items.title: Meet the Alice Springs disability enterprise delivering mail to town camps
items.description: A disability enterprise is partnering with Australia Post to deliver mail to Aboriginal town camps around Alice Springs.

items.title: Southern 80 water ski race cancelled for second year straight
items.description: One past Southern 80 winner and record holder wonders if the race will ever return.

items.title: 'True bubble-like mentality' as markets 'up-crash' into end of 2025
items.description: AI. Market records. Tariffs. Penguins. TACO. It's been a big year of economic shocks and surges as the international framework of global trade was shredded. Here's how key players saw the year that was.

items.title: Teens flock to alternative apps after social media ban
items.description: The Commonwealth's long-awaited social media ban for under-16s came into effect this month. But some experts note a rise in alternatives to popular platforms as teens find ways to stay active on social media.

items.title: Gold mine pays $330,000 after two dust incidents
items.description: One of the country's largest gold mines in the NSW Central West will buy five new dust monitors after incidents at its tailings dam.
